intro: Urostachys urbanii, commonly known as the Tibetan sand saxifrage, is a perennial flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Tibet and northern India. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible or medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, hairy stems, and small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. It thrives in arid, rocky environments and is adapted to withstand extreme temperature fluctuations and low nutrient soils. Due to its unique ecological role and limited distribution, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
